intro: Psychotria elachistantha, commonly known as the "little ghost plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria elachistantha is also noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
